abstract: Like Facebook, Salesforce is turning into a platform for many applications, instead of just a fancy Rolodex. Like Apple it now offers a store where customers can buy the apps themselves.
snippet: Like Facebook, Salesforce is turning into a platform for many applications, instead of just a fancy Rolodex. Like Apple it now offers a store where customers can buy the apps themselves.
lead_paragraph: I’ve got to confess that for the last 10 years I’ve largely ignored Salesforce.com. I knew it was growing through sales of its service, a very fancy Rolodex that helps companies keep track of customers and prospects. And I knew it evangelized the idea that applications for big companies can be delivered through Web pages rather than as software run in a company’s own data center.

headline.main: How Apple and Facebook Influence Salesforce.com
